summary_points: 1. On March 5, 2025, ON Semiconductor Corp (onsemi) publicly proposed to acquire all outstanding common stock of Allegro MicroSystems, Inc. for $35.10 per share in cash.
2. This proposed acquisition represents a 57% premium to Allegro's closing share price on February 28, 2025.

3.  The acquisition's success is subject to several risks, including the possibility that the parties may not reach a definitive agreement, regulatory or shareholder approvals, and the potential for unforeseen liabilities or future capital expenditures.
1. News Corp repurchased approximately US$644,552,238.75 worth of Class A and Class B shares as of March 5th, 2025, under a US$1 billion stock repurchase program.

2. On March 5th, 2025, 21,145,242 Class A shares and 10,432,942 Class B shares were repurchased, at a high price of US$30.69 and US$35.25 respectively and a low of US$14.88 and US$15.17 respectively, with the highest prices paid on February 19th, 2025.
3.  The buyback program's future performance is subject to market conditions, the market price of News Corp's stock, and other factors, with no ASX-listed CDIs to be repurchased.
1. Synopsys, Inc. issued $9.1 billion in senior notes with maturities ranging from 2027 to 2055, at varying interest rates (4.550% to 5.700%), on March 3, 2025.
2.  Net proceeds from the note offering, along with existing cash and borrowings, will fund part of the acquisition of ANSYS, Inc., covering related fees and repaying ANSYS's debt.

3. The Notes Offering is expected to close on March 17, 2025, subject to customary closing conditions;  a Special Mandatory Redemption event could cause the proceeds of certain notes to be used for general corporate purposes instead.

1. Humana Inc. issued $1.25 billion in senior notes on March 5th, 2025, comprised of $750 million in 5.550% notes due 2035 and $500 million in 6.000% notes due 2055, with net proceeds of approximately $1.231 billion.
2.  The net proceeds from the senior notes offering will primarily be used to repay the company's 4.500% Senior Notes due 2025 in April 2025.

3. Humana faces several risks, including insufficient reserves to cover benefit expenses, failure to implement strategic initiatives, and potential negative impacts from a decline in Medicare Advantage plan ratings in 2025.
1. Jonathan J. Nudi, Group President of North America Pet, International, and North America Foodservice, will retire from General Mills on June 30, 2025.
2.  Liz Mascolo will be promoted to Segment President, North America Pet, and join the General Mills Senior Leadership Team on March 16, 2025.
3.  Mr. Nudi's retirement announcement was made on March 5, 2025.
